education.shortDegree: BA in Computer Science & Mechanical Engineering
education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science & Mechanical Engineering

experience.position: Additive Manufacturing Technician & Teacher's Assistant (Mech. Engineering)

projects.title: SLU Center for Additive Manufacturing (SLUCAM) - Research Adjacent
projects.description: At the Saint Louis University Center for Additive Manufacturing, I work with engineering for additive manufacturing, focusing on documenting and providing education regarding SLUCAM' technologies, processes, and best practices. I have also built a custom project management platform for both SLUCAM and other SLU facilities, all while serving as primary liason between SLUCAM and public during tours & outreach.
bullets: Developed technical documentation and standard operating procedures for SLUCAM
Served as primary liason between SLUCAM and public during tours & outreach
Developed a custom project management platform for the SLUCAM & other SLU facilities

Reviewed and interfaced with customers to optimize designs for Additive processes, then prioritized, scheduled, and processed print jobs on systems ranging from consumer to industrial FDM to DLP & SLA, Polyjet, SLS, and fusion processes.

projects.title: Teacher's Assistant
projects.description: Developed the curriculum and lead a team of other TAs to teach the "ESCI 1701" Engineering Fundamentals Studio course, teaching students an introduction to engineering design through an introduction to Solidworks and technical drawing.
bullets: Developed a Spatial Thinking, Technical Drawing, and Solidworks curriculum
Directed a team of 6-12 other TAs, setting their schedules, assigning work, and ensuring students recieved excellent instruction
Taught students the basics of understanding Engineering design by directing them through a series of projects to help them understand "design intent".

projects.title: Apollos
projects.description: I co-op'd at Differential on the Apollos team, developing a private-label social media platform. As part of the Frontend team, I played a key role in constructing our React Native template. Over the process of 31 merged PRs, I drove a feature that secured 3 clients, contributing to over $100k in revenue.
bullets: One of 3 frontend React Native developers, but branched into fullstack
31 merged Pull Requests over summer
Built out a feature that earned Apollos 3 new clients, resulting in $100k+ revenue

projects.title: MTS Xpress
projects.description: Developed a proof-of-concept app and the corresponding backend and database for internal use by Myers sales reps to quickly order consumable hardware. In tests, MTS Express improved efficiency by reducing lag time between a stock outage and a replacement order being placed. The idea has led to over $3 million in new revenue in 2025 and has increased the value of orders 400% and average order value by 160%
bullets: Rapid-prototyped an app to help pitch the idea to leadership
Led to $3.2 million in new revenue from Xpress orders in 2025
Increased average line item count by 400% and average order value by 160%
Led to a 60% voluntary adoption rate among sales reps
Reduced lag time between a stock outage and a replacement order being placed

projects.title: Volunteer Coordinator
projects.description: Served as volunteer coordinator, managing over 160 volunteers each year, providing information, serving as a liason between volunteers and leadership, and ensuring that our guests & volunteers had a great experience.
bullets: Recruited, trained, and managed 650+ volunteers over 4 years
Served in the 6 member executive team, directing the event and ultimately raising a yearly average of $135,000 for Adventure Crew
Directed volunteers through 246 shifts
Developed a volunteer registration & management system

projects.title: 2d23d2
bullets: Three.js powered web app that extrudes a 2d shape into individual 3d objects for textile 3d printing
Custom image processing to compute pixel height and color to print
Procedural 3d object generation at runtime allows rapid file iteration for stylized polyjet textile printing

projects.title: FIRST Robotics
projects.description: Through over a decade, I have been involved in FIRST robotics, allowing me to participate in the world championship and to captain my high school team to the state championship 3 years, winning awards for teamwork, sportsmanship, documentation, software, and hardware design, as well as I earned the highest individual leadership award in the state.
bullets: Founded and captained high school a team that competed in the state championship 3 of 4 years
Participated in the world championship.
Earned the highest individual leadership award in the state
Won individual & team awards for teamwork, sportsmanship, documentation, software, and hardware design
Mentored/coached an inner city high school team and FTA/Emceed tournaments
